meanings.definition: Having or showing strict moral attitudes
meanings.sent1: She was known for her straightlaced approach to life, always following the rules.
meanings.sent2: The straightlaced teacher disapproved of any form of cheating in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The straightlaced librarian raised an eyebrow when she saw someone returning a book a day late.
meanings.sent4: His straightlaced demeanor made him the perfect candidate for the role of the strict judge.
meanings.sent5: The straightlaced nun's dedication to her vows was unwavering.

meanings.sent1: The straightlaced couple preferred traditional values and customs over modern trends.
meanings.sent2: In the straightlaced society of the 1950s, certain behaviors were considered scandalous.
meanings.sent3: The straightlaced family always had the same meal for dinner every Sunday without fail.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe consisted of only straightlaced outfits, never straying from classic styles.
meanings.sent5: The straightlaced businessman adhered strictly to the company's code of conduct.
